description_txt: stated on September 20, 2010 in a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "There's a big chunk of the country that thinks that I have been too soft on Wall Street."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2010 in a statement on campaign web site:
quote_txt: "Under Tom Barrett’s leadership, violent crime in Milwaukee has decreased by over 20% -- to its lowest levels in more than 20 years."

description_txt: stated on July 3, 2010 in a newspaper article:
quote_txt: "I have given $30,000 of my unused travel expenses over the years to supplement the school system's general budget."

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2010 in figures cites on campaign website:
quote_txt: "Florida spends more than $300 million a year just on children repeating pre-K through 3rd grade."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2010 in a campaign video:
quote_txt: "Kasich’s trade deals cost Ohio thousands of jobs - 49,000 jobs to Mexico, 91,000 to China."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2010 in a speech to the Values Voter Summit:
quote_txt: "Speaker Pelosi ... has been busy sticking the taxpayer with her $100,000 bar tab for alcohol on the military jets that she's flying."

description_txt: stated on August 25, 2010 in a campaign news release:
quote_txt: "Julie Lassa willingly took a hefty pay raise at a time when people throughout her district and the state were losing their jobs."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Roy Barnes "made Georgia dead last in education" and Georgia "led the nation in job losses."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says Bill White "didn't pay taxes while earning $133,600 annual salary as deputy secretary of energy."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2010 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: The new health care law "will cut $500 billion from Medicare. That will hurt the quality of our care."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2010 in statements on the party's website.:
quote_txt: Loranne Ausley "voted six times to tax your savings."

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2010 in a campaign fundraising e-mail:
quote_txt: "Ganley said that if elected, he wants to ‘cut the dickens’ out of Social Security, Medicare and Veterans’ benefits."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a TV interview and multiple other sources:
quote_txt: "I've been outspent by my opponents every time I've run for U.S. Senate."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2010 in GOP press release:
quote_txt: "Barnes opposed the creation of the HOPE Scholarship and campaigned against Zell Miller on the issue."

description_txt: stated on August 31, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says the Austin chapter of the League of Women Voters has no Republicans among elected officers or on its debate committee.

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2010 in a statement on campaign web site:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin is one of the highest taxed states in the nation."

description_txt: stated on July 25, 2010 in an e-mail:
quote_txt: After Hurricane Katrina, "Dallas and San Antonio took in 5,000 to 10,000 refugees each, but (Bill) White brought in 250,000 and put them up in his 'buddies' empty apartment buildings and let the federal government pay their rents for over two years. They did not return to New Orleans, most of them are on welfare."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2010 in an interview on Fox News' "On the Record with Greta Van Susteren":
quote_txt: Rhode Island gives undocumented pregnant women health insurance, plus a cash card "with $400 a month on it" and "$250 a month or $275 a month to spend on food."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Ron Johnson’s company got government loans and a grant to help expand his business

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2010 in a campaign website:
quote_txt: Ron Klein "repeatedly voted in favor of amnesty for illegal immigrants."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in an interview on CNN's "Larry King Live":
quote_txt: "Do you know that we have pipes carrying natural gas in this country that are made of wood? I'm not joking."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2010 in a political ad:
quote_txt: "As the CEO of HP, Carly Fiorina laid off 30,000 workers."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a campaign commerical:
quote_txt: Harry Reid has voted "to give special tax breaks to illegal aliens."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Harry Reid has voted "to give illegals Social Security benefits even for the time they were here illegally."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2010 in a posting to the state's Office of Management and Budget website:
quote_txt: About $4.89 billion in one-time money was used to balance the current state general revenue fund budget.

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2010 in a meeting with reporters in Tallahassee:
quote_txt: "The stimulus has not created one private sector job."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "Taxes went down under Jerry Brown."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2010 in a series of campaign TV ads:
quote_txt: Tom Barrett "voted for the largest tax increase in history ... raising taxes on gas and Social Security."

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says he created more than 500 American jobs.

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: Horse racing could boost Georgia's economy by $1 billion a year and create 10,000 to 20,000 jobs.
